page.title: 01DEFINING THE AREA
page.content: The area lies east of Rutherglen and extends as far as the Rotten Calder which is a left bank tributary of the River Clyde,which flows westwards,and passes approximately one kilometre to the north of our block. To the south lies the New Town of East Kilbride. The greater part of our area is farmland ,largely dairying.Sheep rearing to is practised on a small scale. Some cereal cultivation takes place on a small scale on favoured slopes,but cultivated grassland predominates on account of altitude There is a residential area in the northwest corner of the block,which can be divided into two sections according to occupation and income
